alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 19 at 5:44PM MST until August 19 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 630 PM MST. * At 542 PM MST, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles southeast of Burro Creek Campground, or 18 miles northeast of Alamo Lake, moving south at 15 mph near Highway 93 south of Wikieup. HAZARD...Quarter size hail, winds up to 45 mph, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of Yavapai County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Heavy rainfall has the potential to greatly reduce visibility creating hazardous driving conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
